title: What happened?
content:
Okay so I’ve been away for a while, but I didn’t expect to see the Typophile forum in such a bad shape. It saddens me to see a forum that used to have a high standard in page layout subside all of a sudden – what happened?

 [‹ New National Geographic](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14848 "Go to previous forum topic") [When does faux Chinese style lettering show up? 19th Century? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34748 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Kristian M

comments.content:
Kristian, are you by any chance using a Mac running OS 9 software? Because there was a recent site and server upgrade; this might cause you to see pages that appear to have a very primitive layout. I had the same problem a few days ago.

Check out [**this entry**](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34862) for more info on the server upgrade.

Also have a look [**here**](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34879)... and [**here**](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34692)... and [**here**](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34830).

:-)
